instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: This one won't start from battery and it won't show anything on the battery indicator. With magsafe connected it starts and charges the battery. There is no X on the battery icon. It runs from battery if magsafe is disconnected. Nothing changes if I disconnect the BIL

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> only battery?? Battery status on OSX?? Could be bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12,15 volt with only battery. Battery status on OS X is normal

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: It does show all the info about battery??? Cicles, amp, etc...??

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
yes, but indicator on the side doesn't work.
My guess right now is <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> or <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: or maybe not....

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: Try other BIL...

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: have done that. The big problem is that it wont start from battery. Don't think that BIL need to be connected to start from battery

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: Something is pulling down <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> . I get 1.5 volt at pin four on the battery connector. On another bord with same battery I get 3,4 volt

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: Measure in diode mode <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> and report values....

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: SCL is 0,497 and SDA is 0,500

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: There is nothing wrong with the data bus if the battery is recognized fully in OSX. I doubt you checked this as the BIL does not work and there is no power from battery. Check the pull up resistors and otherwise it is dead SMC/<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
When the computer is running <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> goes up to 3,4 volt. But when it is off it's only 1,5.
checked three other macbooks and they are all showing 3,4 when off.

[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] Dont understand what you meen with this "I doubt you checked this as the BIL does not work and there is no power from battery"
It works from battery but it wont start from battery.

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: SMC or ISL. It will not stay on from battery I bet.

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: if <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> is normal, Bat connector looks clean, BIL change has not effect, and PPV3V42 is present... I would try replacing <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>, Zenor's can be a bit funny

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
This One almost work now. It boots from battery. 
The problem is that the fan starts spinning before login screen. And after a few minutes the coursor is hacking and everything feels slow. When i run it without the battery its all good. I have tried different trackpads, bil-connectors and batteries with no luck.

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
Try other HDD.
Also try your USB test OSX, disconnecting flex for internal HDD.
Fan still start high if you leave the machine waiting in boot menu?

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
Yes, fan speed is high in boot menu. Asd efi and asd os show no errors. 
It works perfect without battery.

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
Connect the battery whitout seating it into the case (on top of trackpad); let the battery out of case.
Fan still high without battery?

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: I?m 90% sure the problem is on the logicboard. But I dont Know exactly how the battery circuit works.

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> with both, battery and charger connected.

"Fan still high without battery?"

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
Pin 15 0,053v
pin 9 0,66-0,69 pulsing up and down
at fuse with only battery it?s pulsing between 11,67-11,74

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
"pin 9 0,66-0,69 pulsing up and down"
Is that reading with both charger and battery connected, in off state?
If not, check it now.
Also post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage in the same condition.

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message: Need to sleep... I?ll check tomorrow. Thanks for your help

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
When off, pin 9 is 0,5v and pin 15 is 0
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12,49

threads.title: 2936 won't start from battery
threads.message:
"pin 9 is 0,5v and pin 15 is 0"
Something is strange there, AMON is too high; battery doesn't seem to sink current.
So check again <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 and their traces to <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.
Also check pin9 without battery connected.
